channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Junction littered with potholes with one very large pothole on Mill Lane, 12th December
item.description:
Junction between Mill Lane and Vicarage Lane littered with potholes with one very deep one on Mill Lane. Pothole on Mill Lane likely to be deeper than a tennis ball
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Mill Lane, Brockworth, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Leaves building up, 12th December
item.description:
The permitted parking spaces have become very muddy due to the recent wet weather and fallen leaves. The leaves are now wet and compacted, making the ground slippery and messy. This creates a hazard for pedestrians as well as drivers, increasing the risk of slips and falls. Some of the leaves are also blocking drains, which could make the mud and water buildup worse if not cleared. Clearing the leaves and addressing the mud would help make the parking spaces safer and prevent further drainage problems.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Selkirk Street, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 6 CM Deep Pothole on Hearne Road, 12th December
item.description:
There is a deep (4 - 6 cm) pothole about 20 metres from the junction between Church Street and Hearne Road. This is on the left hand side of the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 25, Hearne Road, Cheltenham

item.title: 16 inch pot hole / water access cover sunk, 12th December
item.description:
Pot hole and access cover sunk - outside 95 Montpellier Terrace. Issue has been progressively worsening over 3 years. Reported twice before. Likely a water company access cover as they have fixed parallel faults on road. Buses and large vehicles passing over hole are loud and shake a Grade II listed property.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 97, Montpellier Terrace, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Falling branches from lime trees producing potential danger, 12th December
item.description:
I am reporting an urgent problem with lime trees in Kensington Avenue, GL502NQ. Branches have been falling in recent weeks, especially during gales and high winds. It is only a matter of time before cars or buildings will be damaged by falling branches The trees are dangerously covered with mistletoe which is obviously weakening
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, Kensington Avenue, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
